conclusion: Millikan oil-drop experiment setup with two metal plates and oil droplets acquiring charge.
Two spherical oil droplets A and B are located on the same vertical line between two plates.
Droplets fall with uniform velocity through distance h1 in time t, voltage U applied, B moves upwards, A continues falling.
Air resistance formula given as f = k m^(1/3)v, air buoyancy negligible, gravity is g.
Determine uniform velocity v1 of droplets without voltage using equilibrium of forces.
Determine uniform velocity v2 of droplet B with voltage applied using equilibrium of forces.
Electric force Fe given by qU/d where q is the charge on droplet B.
Solve for v2: v2 = (qU - m0gd)/(k m0^(1/3)).
Determine height h2 traveled by droplet B: h2 = v2 t.
Determine height h1 traveled by droplet A: h1 = v1 t.
Relate heights h1 and h2 using expressions for v1 and v2.
Equate expressions for h1 and h2 to solve for k.
Simplify to solve for k: m0^(2/3) g = (qU - m0gd)/m0^(1/3).
Multiply both sides by m0^(1/3) and solve for k.
Final expression for k: k = (m0^(2/3) g)/h1.
